New Records: Cleveland joins the 2015-16 Warriors as the only teams since 2000 to start a season 33-4 or better and is just the seventh team to do so in NBA history
Key Match Events: Darius Garland dropped 40 points and nine assists, including a lead-extending 3 with 40 seconds left to boost Cleveland’s win streak to 12 while improving its record to an NBA-best 33-4
Garland scored 25 points in the 2nd half on 9-of-12 shooting to help the Cavs rally from a 12-point 3rd-quarter deficit
In the clutch this season, Garland is shooting 19-of-29 (65.5%), the best FG% in the NBA among players with 20+ attempts
Garland ranks first in plus-minus (+62) and second in assist/turnover ratio (10:1) in clutch time
Post-Match Reflections: Cavs coach Kenny Atkinson on Garland postgame: 'He single-handedly took over this game.'
